intro: Spergularia colorata proles australis, commonly known as the Australian red sandras, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with prostrate stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. This species is often found in coastal dunes and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
